website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive dovetail jig that will be very easy to use for someone who is new to this hobby.
pros: Less expensive than most dovetail jigs on the market
Design forces you to align the pieces properly every time before you can start cutting
Makes use of aluminum construction, ensuring good results for basic jobs
cons: Not a heavy-duty tool or one that can perform a lot of different kinds of cuts

customer_reviews.title: Works well, accurate, and most importantly-AFFORDABLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product despite all the bad reviews. I can chalk up the bad reviews to user error and/or having a crappy router. I ran this on my Bosch table router setup. It made perfect joints after tuning the bit height and the depth gauge on the jig itself. I wouldnt want to use this without a router table though. If you want something that will work well and not break the bank, this is the way to go. If I could change one thing, it would be the bit. Bit will need replacing sooner than later after doing a lot of joints in red oak.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product on the following conditions:
customer_reviews.text: I have read all the reviews and seen all the ratings for this product before placing the order. I have it now for more than 6 weeks and let me say it is excellent product for beginner and intermediate woodworker. The only problem with the product is its manual, just throw it away since it lacks the logic and sequential thinking and go to Youtube and you will find at least three or four video explaining 90% of its use and the remaining 10% you will figure out while you are using that jig. The four stars because of the confusing manual but it is good product and comes at affordable price compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have no previous woodworking skills, though I do have a router I bought 20 years ago but never used. I spent about half hour on YouTube and the day it came I set it up and made dovetail joints for a shoeshine box. It worked perfectly, all the lines and joints are straight and it looks great. I don’t understand the negative reviews from people who claim they couldn’t get it to work right. I’m pretty sure they just can’t follow simple directions. I highly recommend for the novice.
customer_reviews.author: M.B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sorry
customer_reviews.text: The device is a user and not new ... There is no instructions how to use .. Amazon must put laws to protect the buyer .. This is the second time I find it used This is my response after using it .. Tired tool is inaccurate and difficult to install .. The tool needs to develop ..
customer_reviews.author: abomlak

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked with this jig for a few hours. I'm pretty good at figuring stuff out. Instructions are more complicated than they need to be. Some youtube videos helped, but all in all the best I could get was 'almost ok.' decided to stop trying when I realized the bit had dulled considerably. Not nearly enough usage on soft wood to accept that. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. If you're on a tight budget, buy the Harbor Freight. If you can afford a little more and want better quantity buy the Porter Cable, although I would suggest the 4212 which will give you the ability to cut half blind and through dovetails. If money is no object maybe the Leigh, although I don't have any personal experience with the Leigh.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G. Lowry

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product, sloppy dovetails, instruction guide is so completely vague and nonsensical. Dont waste your hard earned money for such a sloppy product.
customer_reviews.author: oz

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: The jig works fine. Instead of reading the sometimes confusing directions, view the instructional video on YouTube on how to use the tool. It is a two part video and shows the user how the tool functions by either a hand held router or a router table. Search "General tools EZ pro dovetail jig."
customer_reviews.author: bruce geddes

customer_reviews.title: Overall OK but not great
customer_reviews.text: Set up is not as straight forward. The clamping is good for thin and wide stocks. However the dovetail bit bearing already broke after an hour used; does not seem to work with larger than 1/2" thickness wood board. Overall 4/5 star; good enough for armature repeated works but not for detailing. Skip this and save money if you can saw a dovetail by hand; or better use this money to buy a dovetail saw/chisel.
customer_reviews.author: My T. Ha

customer_reviews.title: Okay for occasional dovetail joint, small projects like a single box.
customer_reviews.text: Found it a bit difficult to use and cumbersome. It gets the job done at a cheap price versus others, but I ended up buying a Porter Cable dovetail jig. This jig is good for the occasional dovetail joint, but not if you are going to do many for a project. If you see yourself doing many dovetail joints, get a bigger jig to save yourself a LOT of time.
customer_reviews.author: MT in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. It flexes when you tighten the board ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Poor design . It flexes when you tighten the board down. This leaves a gap in the bottom of the dovetail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this product, he is a designer and installs cabinets. sometimes he has to build drawers and this product makes his job a lot easier. He is very happy but I still don't know if he used it
customer_reviews.author: lore

customer_reviews.title: This product was defective, and after making several crooked ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was defective, and after making several crooked joints, I contacted the manufacturer with pictures and they accepted it back. I replaced it with a more expensive model. This model does not make both joints at the same time, as some do, so it takes a little more time. If you have the patience it is an acceptable option to the more expensive products.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Works but I wish it was a bit stronger
customer_reviews.text: The setup took some trial and error. The jig is aluminum and bends it you tighten it to tight. It is the first time I used dove tail jig so some one with experience might setup it up faster.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: New to this but I think its good
customer_reviews.text: Just started playing around with this jig, self teaching myself. Thank God for YouTube videos. I'm sure the full size jigs have their niche and probably work a little easier, but so far I believe this will work fine. You just have to utilize clamps to hold things down. Not too difficult. And the price difference makes this a nice choice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clary

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: This jig is cutting the tails almost an 1/8" thicker than the pin openings. So then it takes twice as long to shift the board over and cut the tails smaller, and is a guessing game. Otherwise this jig is pretty neat.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T

customer_reviews.title: Great small Jig.
customer_reviews.text: The jig works great. It takes a bit to figure it out. The customer service guy really went out of his way in helping me. He even found a few YouTube videos that were a great help.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is solid and made well, reasonable price. It is a bit tricky to use but part of that may be me and also maybe our router too.
customer_reviews.author: kenpo saber

customer_reviews.title: Small Job Tool
customer_reviews.text: A light duty tool which probably would work for small jobs. Will not reach deep enough for full dovetails on 3/4" material.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good about this products. Exactly as advertise. Works great I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Domingue

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: does not work with plywood drawer side stock, very difficult to use and flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure about this one by reading the reviews, but after using it I found it does do a nice dovetail. If you read the instructions and with a little trial and error on some scrap wood it works as described. Very happy with it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Heise

customer_reviews.title: This will work just fine for the few joints I will make in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to make some dovetail joints in a custom tool carrier but didn't want to spend a bundle. This will work just fine for the few joints I will make in my lifetime. The instructions are detailed enough for even a beginning woodworker to get a perfect joint from the first try.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Eno

customer_reviews.title: Dont sell bad engineering
customer_reviews.text: Bad item.nothing feet property. Spend money for nothing good. Pins Screws of lockers broken.
customer_reviews.author: list yak

customer_reviews.title: Practical jig
customer_reviews.text: This tool is extremely practical to make dovetails. It is easy to set up and the joints aligns perfectly and with an snug fit. To understand how it works is better to watch the videos posted in Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Escalante

customer_reviews.title: Fit not so good
customer_reviews.text: Was simple enough to use but joint is far from a good fit lots of sanding and reshape of tails for proper fit
customer_reviews.author: Marshall LaCasse

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice dovetails
customer_reviews.text: The jig is easy to use. The enclosed instructions are clear but it helps to watch a video. I used it to make two drawers with half inch lumber and am very pleased with the result, especially since I am new to woodworking!
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Good jig, gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Took me a hot minute to wrap my head around how to properly set this up, but after carefully and thouroughly reading the manual and watching a couple youtube videos I made some great blind dovetails for my project without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give less than one star
customer_reviews.text: Did not work like advertised. Not the sellers fault. The pins do not line up properly and the router bit is ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but still had to chisel a little to get a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: butterat

customer_reviews.title: Good jig. Misleading instructions
customer_reviews.text: First off. Read the instructions then throw away. I wasted some time trying to do some box joints by going by instructions. So I look at some videos and after a few practices got it pretty quickly. That was my experience. Aside from that I recommend the jig. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Matt scott

customer_reviews.title: New to woodworking
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to woodworking and have taken it up as a hobby. This jig worked great for my purposes. It's takes some time getting used too, but that is due to my inexperience, not the jig. Just be careful to make sure the set screw on the router bit is tight. Mine came loose and I had to order another one. Customer service was great in helping me find where to purchase a replacement bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clever design, but don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: In theory this is a nice unit and design. I spent several hours trying to get this jig to give me acceptable results. Thoroughly reading the instructions, watching videos and endless test pieces, I could not get a sarisfactory dovetail joint. I returned this product and ordered the Porter Cable jig. In a matter of minutes, my second test piece had perfect dovetail joints, that I was able to replicate precisely. Do yourself a favor and buy the Porter Cable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Useful jig.
customer_reviews.text: Router bit was missing set screw to hold bearings in place! Other than that it’s a useful jig
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice price for this
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a lot of dovetailing so I didn't want to spend 200-300 bucks on a jig. This one will work for me and maybe I'll be doing more dove work now that I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It was donated, and very well received. Customer service was excellent and more than patient.
customer_reviews.author: Storming Bunnies

customer_reviews.title: great seller
customer_reviews.text: simple and easy to use, the end results is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Fun and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: first time I've ever used a router jig, I was planning on making a lot of scraps, after 3 passes and slight router adj. Worked beautiful. Read and understand the user instructions- and you will be surprised. I love it and am constantly looking to use it.Just have to get an allen wrench that fits the jig's built in depth gauge(gate).
customer_reviews.author: David Dicus

customer_reviews.title: Practice makes perfect
customer_reviews.text: Practice makes perfect. Would love if it had a better bit but doeß the job for the price..
customer_reviews.author: Mark Macklin

customer_reviews.title: Simple-  and it works.  Good value for the money if you're just a home woodworker.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice- worked right out of the box- first try produced a usable Dovetail joint.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: Got for a great price. This is a simpler and quicker set ...
customer_reviews.text: Got for a great price. This is a simpler and quicker set up then my more expensive dovetail jigs the only issue is you are limited to types and sizes of dovetails you can do.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Graham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fairly ingenious. It takes some effort to get it dialed in, but then you're off and running.
customer_reviews.author: JackP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The tool is cheaply made. It is not consistent when it cuts. I used it one day for 2 hours trying to get it to work and I already throw it away. Loss my money.
customer_reviews.author: luis olmojimenez

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Biggest problem I have is the bearing locking nut fell out. How and where do get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Joe Laney

customer_reviews.title: Made this weekend warrior look like a pro
customer_reviews.text: I have no furniture making experience, but I impressed my friends. I just used a router, a table, and clamps. Carpenter friend asked me if I was making drawers to hold a bowling ball. Youtube videos were extremely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Choi

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: 20 minutes after opening the box, the drawer dovetails were completed and looks great. I had watched the YouTube videos before purchasing so I pretty much knew how to set up the jig. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the cheaper jigs in Amazon and I now know why after using it. Aluminum bends, and jig requires many extra steps that are aleviated by better set ups.
customer_reviews.author: Shane O.

customer_reviews.title: Best dovetail jig out there
customer_reviews.text: Best dovetail jig I have ever owned hands down also the easiest
customer_reviews.author: NYBOWHUNTER

customer_reviews.title: Dovetail Jig
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas gift & the person who received it is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Gocken

customer_reviews.title: Good for small projects
customer_reviews.text: Works well but is limited to smaller projects. It says you can move it to make larger cuts, but that tends to cause errors. I like it for anything 4 inches or under.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Dovetails the easy way.
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my router table exclusively. I put down a piece (18x18) of sheet metal for a flat surface and put a 1/2" hole through it so only the bit sticks up. With the above setup, I get a fairly accurate and quick joint with very little set up. I use this for most of my drawers and gotta say it's pretty convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Joe and Suzanne Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great for dovetails and box cuts. Makes cutting a breeze. Very sturdy. Bit that came with it a little cheap but does the job
customer_reviews.author: Michael Greene

customer_reviews.title: Dovetails made easy even for novices
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice woodworker and have been trying many different methods of drawer joinery dados, rabbits, kreg jig etc. I always wanted to try dovetails but I really had no interest in making my own jig. I purchased this product and I love it! It creates perfect dovetails. One thing I found is that it worked best with softer wood like poplar or pine. When using hardwood plywood there was a lot off splintering. It could be that I need to adjust the router speed? Either way. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: K. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Followed directions exactly multiple times and the joints wouldn’t fit together...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Menard

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made! The tool flexes in your hands while ...
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made! The tool flexes in your hands while you're using it. And you will have to adjust your work piece and make a second pass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My husband made beautiful dovetailed drawers for my bathroom vanity.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie Pendergrass

customer_reviews.title: Instructions in pamphlet not always clear that’s why only. ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions in pamphlet not always clear that’s why only. 4 stars, but once you get to grips with that the jig it’s self is 5 out of 5. Well made and study ,would advise you watch youtube video this helps a lot. But must say well done general.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. W Colson

customer_reviews.title: Really cool tool.
customer_reviews.text: Does all the dovetails you could really want or need. Easily set up and easily executed. Full instructions come with, as well as videos on youtube explain how to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: QuiteTrite

customer_reviews.title: I'm making beautifully joined boxes
customer_reviews.text: Very eassy and friendly to use; save time and no headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: but the jig works great - need to buy the collars that support the ...
customer_reviews.text: bit broke after about 20 drawers, but the jig works great - need to buy the collars that support the jig.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: the router bit poorly made
customer_reviews.text: the router bit broke with the second cut + the dove tails were not very clean cut
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: general tools dovetailer jig
customer_reviews.text: very nice well crafted and very simple to use. I was glad I found it here on amazon it was atleast $20 + more from lowes and you still had to order it.
customer_reviews.author: zundlem

customer_reviews.title: I never made dove tail in my life but out ...
customer_reviews.text: I never made dove tail in my life but out of the box I cut two that give me hope.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Franz

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this to a friend
customer_reviews.text: NOT the easiest thing in the world to use but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E.

customer_reviews.title: Before usage, check for squareness
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice Idea, and I really wanted to like it. The problem is it's not square, plastic and metal parts that don't align properly, the plastic is warped. As a result the depth of the cut is not consistent. The plastic parts should have been made of metal. The design is nice, but the quality of manufacture is terrible. I've attached a photo of the issue. If you buy this, due to poor quality control, check for squareness in all dimensions, even the metal may be warped. Also keep in mind plastic expands and contracts far more than metal with temperature changes.
customer_reviews.author: NjWood

customer_reviews.title: works like I had hoped it would
customer_reviews.text: I have never done dovetails before and am building a dresser with 6 drawers. I needed a starter dovetail jig and this did the trick. It is not the best jig in the world, but for the price it does a great job. You have to take your time figuring out the instructions and practice on some scraps to get it all set up. But if you are patient it will produce some decent, tight fitting joints. Not the highest quality in the world but great for the average woodworker who is just doing some occasional dovetails.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Cole

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use, but the supplied bit isn't so hot. The bearing came apart after 7 cuts. If you buy this make sure to have another bit on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S.

customer_reviews.title: but you won’t get perfect joints.
customer_reviews.text: This item was not built flat. It’s an okay product, but you won’t get perfect joints.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: It makes functional dovetails but they are not beautiful. I called customer service multiple times over a ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but takes lots of testing and adjusting. It makes functional dovetails but they are not beautiful. I called customer service multiple times over a weeks time and never got any help and no one ever called back. The bit broke on the second drawer I made but they sent two free ones so ... Hobby level tool not for business quality work.
customer_reviews.author: RU12HI5

customer_reviews.title: Nice once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little more clear on the instructions, but i found a video that help out tons!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Reed

customer_reviews.title: Very good product! I wanted to see if I could ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product! I wanted to see if I could teach myself how to dovetail. With the online support and classes, it was easy!
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Neat tool - did just what I needed with good results and at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excelent product and have a high precision for dove tails
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Reuther

customer_reviews.title: If you can follow directions you can make perfect dovetails of unlimited length
customer_reviews.text: First dovetail joint I cut with it came out perfectly, no problems at all. BTW, it was also the first dovetail jig I've ever used and the first dovetail joint I'd ever cut. Not sure why so many people are having trouble with it. Maybe they just like to bash things made in China or want to sell Porter Cable units.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Compono

customer_reviews.title: This was like the other 3 types on dovetail jigs that I purchased in the past.  Performance fell far short of advertising hype.
customer_reviews.text: As usual the Internet video portrayed this as a fool-proof, use it straight out of the box for perfect joints. That was not the case. The included dovetail router bit was poorer quality than expected. With much practice and patience, decent results might be attainable using soft wood, but my results with hard maple were abysmal. This is my fourth and final effort to buy a dovetail jig that promised ease of use and professional results. So this is fini for me as I'll continue to hand-cut less-than-perfect dovetails.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Brzostek

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Basic and a little fiddly, an inexpensive addition that introduced me to doing dovetail joins.
customer_reviews.author: Murray scrivenor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Fits description perfectly and cuts beautiful dovetails directly out of the box. Definitely the best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: Brandon forrest

customer_reviews.title: Once you learn how to tweak it, it makes dovetails stupid easy.
customer_reviews.text: Make several practice runs on scrap. It took some time to get the adjustments just right. Once I learned how to use it, it made dovetail joints stupid easy and good looking. There are several video tutorials on YouTube - the music is annoying, but they help a ton. The version I videos are about the same as the version II ones - version II added better router table handles and pressure bars instead of individual cups.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great little Dovetailer
customer_reviews.text: The Jig is not the biggest and most flexible on the market but I am using it for making storage boxes for my work area and for the price and flexibility I have found it of good value. It can be used either with a standalone router or on a table which I find the easiest. If you want to start with dovetails and do not want to pay a lot more for the super duper jigs then this is one I would recommend. John
customer_reviews.author: John Coombes

customer_reviews.title: this one will go to good will or
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy the porter cable it is much sturdier, easier to use and works with thicker material. I bought this for a project using 3/4 wood, it was not very effective. I then bought the porter cable, this one will go to good will or something
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for drawers
customer_reviews.text: After carefully reading others reviews and gathering that the instructions need careful review before using I followed others advice and took my time. This unit is truly simple to use. Made drawers first time no mistakes. Always make a little extra materiel for set up tests. This not versatile like expensive jigs but very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: simple tool and attachments
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of the easiest tools to use for some one like me with very little wood working experience. After reading instructions and looking at the jig, everything is clear to me. I have not used the jig yet, but I will test it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: AW199

customer_reviews.title: Simple Dovetail Jig
customer_reviews.text: For the everyday shop dovetailing this jig works really nice. Easy to use and with alittle practice you can make quality dovetails.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas N. White

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This jig works perfectly with my router table. I recommend using a router table to ensure that the router bit is perpendicular to the wood surface.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps usefull as a speciality tool but if you are ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps usefull as a speciality tool but if you are looking to do any quantity of dovetailing this is not the tool you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lovejoy

customer_reviews.title: Bad jig
customer_reviews.text: This jig is a joke. Even the gaps between the tail slots are not the same width. The key they give you would not fit between one of the tail gaps.
customer_reviews.author: Brian V.

customer_reviews.title: ... bow so it is nearly impossible to get a perfect dovetail from it
customer_reviews.text: Built in clamps make it bow so it is nearly impossible to get a perfect dovetail from it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Flinker

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the clains say it is.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it worked as good as the claims are. One good set of dovetails and 30 that suck. Gotta try a different jig.
customer_reviews.author: edward pascu

customer_reviews.title: This jig is truly a disappointment. After three practice cuts in Pine one of ...
customer_reviews.text: This jig is truly a disappointment. After three practice cuts in Pine one of the guide bearings on the router bit self destructed. Luckily, I was not hit by the debris. The depth gauge for the pins moves after tightening-botching up the depth of cut. Allen screw for the depth gauge is too small. The diameter of the bolts that secure the work pieces to the jig are also too small a diameter, and feel flimsy during tightening. Instructions are ridiculous. Website video about set up has no audio. This item is worth $20. at most.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT tool and is super easy to get great joints.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Fournier

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps there is something wrong with me. I bought this after watching the EZ video in which it looked simple. I just can't get anything decent out of it. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the hobbist
customer_reviews.text: The jig worked perfectly although my vise slipped and the router damaged the plastic depth gauge, it's still doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ken A Prince

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this jig.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with product. Great flawless joints after minimum setting up. Instructions easy to use. Delivered to London in the UK very quickly and hassle free. First project was a watch case with great half dovetail feature.
customer_reviews.author: turkel mahmout

customer_reviews.title: very awesome
customer_reviews.text: super easy to use and learn, it was as easy as it is described , I love it to death!!
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: it does the job easily and correctly
customer_reviews.text: I did a review video which you can see on my You Tube channel. It's definitely worth the price. it does the job easily and correctly. The only problem I had it the set screw for the bearing collar either wasn't there to begin with or it came out on my first test. I had a hard time finding the correct screw at my local Ace Hardware and once I found a replacement I saw the problem was that the screw hole wasn't tapped correctly and that's why it went missing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent a few very frustrating hour trying to use this jig. In a nut shell, if you follow the directions you will not get good results. I so wish I'd just paid for a better tool. Too much flex in the tool, bad bad directions.
customer_reviews.author: jimstur

customer_reviews.title: Not put to actual use yet.
customer_reviews.text: I've not actually used this yet but have tinkered around with it. It seems to be as easy as described in the videos on youtube. I would still recommend it though.
customer_reviews.author: Lewalke

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have a collar and bushing backup
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great jig, but about 3 cuts into it, one of the bearings broke on the bit. Without their specially designed bit, or a router with an equivalent collar and bushing set, the jig cannot be used.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: The plantlla have a problem is misaligned more than one ...
customer_reviews.text: The plantlla have a problem is misaligned more than one millimeter and not served . I live in Colombia. La plantlla tiene un problema esta desalineada más de un milimetro y no sirvio. Yo vivo en Colombia.
customer_reviews.author: rene perdomo

customer_reviews.title: A nice little jig
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine used, but it came with everything it was supposed to. As a hobbiest this is perfect. Out of the box you can cut some nice dovetails with very little effort. With holiday season coming, this will be put to great use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

product_meta.title: General Tools 861 Portable Aluminum Dovetail Jig, 12-inch, Woodworking, Furniture Building & Cabinet Making With Router Bit
product_meta.description:
General Tools 861 EZ Pro Dovetailer 2 Dovetail Jig is the all-in-one answer to producing strong, precise dovetail joints with ease right out-of-the-box. Using only the jig and a handheld or table router, both professionals and novices can make half-blind or through dovetail joints including box joints. The self-aligning design ensures that both ends of the dovetail joint match up evenly every time, and new table router control knobs promise comfortable and accurate use. THE DOVETAILER is fully portable, includes a 1/2" dovetail router bit and features sturdy machined aluminum construction along with integrated clamps for precise attachment to the work piece. It is perfect for furniture building, cabinet making and other carpentry projects.

GENERAL TOOLS - THE PRECISE TOOL FOR DOING THE JOB EXACTLY RIGHT. Offering over 1,000 tools, we’re proud to provide tradesmen, craftsmen and DIYers around the world with a broad range of affordable, specific-purpose mechanical hand tools and precision measuring and inspection tools.

For inquiries, please contact our Customer Service Department at 212-431-6100. We strive to provide our customers with 100% satisfaction.

WORK SMARTER, MEASURE BETTER & BE MORE PRODUCTIVE WITH GENERAL TOOLS
feature_bullets: WOODWORKING MADE EASY- All-in-one 861 Dovetail Jig produces strong, precise dovetail joints right out-of-the-box quickly and easily
SELF ALIGNING DESIGN- Ensures that both ends of the dovetail joint match up evenly every time
ADJUSTABLE- Can accommodate boards of any width and easily adjusts the dovetail interference to create loose or tight joints
DURABLE- One-piece aluminum construction with integrated clamps allow precise clamping of jig to work piece while the table router control knobs assure safe, comfortable and accurate use
INCLUDES: (1) 861 Dovetail Jig & (1) 14-degree, 1/2 -inch dovetail router bit for use with hand table or table router
